Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2013000033.CaseDesc: Bernard Deromer was last seen at the metro station Berri UQAM on June 5, 1982. He is blind and walks with a white cane. He may have been approached by a religious sect.

Teeth: Other, upper front tooth obliquely broken
Scar: Right Ear, near the right ear
Other: blind and walks with a white cane

Case reference: 2005004199.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, this male was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 8 miles north of Port Weller. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 156 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He had likely been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Natural teeth with restorations of his upper and lower posterior teeth.

Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2013000098.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1974, eight men were on a drilling barge. As they were making no headway against a strong current, it was agreed upon to park the barge for the night. The eight men worked together to park the vessel however one of the legs failed to lower, causing the barge to tip. Donald Bradburn was amongst the men who were thrown from the barge. Despite dragging operations Mr. Bradburn has never been located.

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2014001985.CaseDesc: Odette Richard was last seen on February 25, 1990 at approximately 6:30 p.m., when she went for a walk from her home in Laval, Quebec. Odette has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Other, Full, upper and lower dentures
Deformity: Right Foot, Bone bump, top of foot

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014004759.CaseDesc: On the 21st day of March, 2006, Tayven BEAR was playing with two other children on the ice of the Churchill River in Sandy Bay. Tayven fell into the river and his body was never recovered.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing 4 front upper teeth
Jacket: Nylon, Blue, Waist length ski jacket

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000049.CaseDesc: On May 9, 2008, Jean-Francois Rousseau was seen for the last time near the Mont-Tremblant park in Quebec.

Shirt: Blue, White, Plaided dark and doubled
Scar: Forehead, vertical in the middle of the forehead

Case reference: 2014003880.CaseDesc: Yvon Robitaille was last seen on the evening of April 1, 1996, as he was travelling on 3rd Avenue in Val-d'Or. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003550.CaseDesc: Kenneth James Schmit, who went by "Jimmy", was last seen leaving a social gathering at a home in St. Walburg, SK, at 10:30 p.m. on September 22, 1966. Mr. Schmit was despondent, and, at the time of his disappearance, had a heavy beard. Numerous searches of the area were conducted, however, Mr. Schmit was not located.

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2016065655.CaseDesc:
On May 27, 1978, a female was found floating 1000 feet off the west shore of Fighting Island, Sandwich West Township in the Detroit River. 
Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 155lbs, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
It is estimated that she had been in the water for a couple of days to a couple of weeks.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations and is missing her upper left canine tooth
Blouse: Multi-coloured long-sleeved button front, floral & green square pattern "Lennington California"Brand
Socks: Cotton, Multi-coloured red and yellow elasticized cotton ankle socks
Other: Intrauterine device implanted in her uterus.

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014046118.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an adult male were found on Little Shell Island near Sidney, British Columbia in 2012. The man’s age was estimated between 20 and 60 years old, and may have gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014038571.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1983, the body of this adult male was found on the south shore of Kamloops Lake east of the community of Savona in British Columbia. He had long black hair and numerous tattoos on his arms. It is believed he was deceased a few months prior to his body being recovered.

Tattoo: Left Arm, Mary C and Love, Marlene and Karene crossed-out
Right Arm, Edna and another unidentifiable tattoo

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, “Rocky” FIDDLER, 14 years old, was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned, as a result of the investigation, that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014003382.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1988, Mr. Umpherville and a friend were driving to The Pas where they stayed the night. In the morning the two departed The Pas via 20 foot yawl with the intent on going to Easterville. They departed the Umpherville settlement around 1300hrs and they briefly stopped at Pine Bluff around 1600 hrs. It is believed they then stopped at a friends trappers cabin at Rat Hunting and ate a meal. The last thing the survivor remembers, is seeing the lights of Easterville and he crawled to the front of the boat where he fell asleep. He awoke around 0500 hrs the next day and Mr. Umpherville was no longer in the boat and he was adrift. Numerous islands in the area were searched, shorelines were searched and several air and water patrols were made without success. Mr. Umpherville has not been located and his whereabouts is unknown.

Hat: Grey, baseball style with "Hi Ho Hi Ho" on front

Case reference: 2018041276.CaseDesc:
John Russell Kenny, originally from Ontario, resided without a fixed address in Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Mr. Kenny was known for travelling by train.

Case reference: 2014004060.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1973, Conor Sheehan was seen for the last time when he left his family residence in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2014001181.CaseDesc: On December 2nd, 2007, Codiac RCMP responded to a complaint of a person found deceased, close to Mapleton Road, in Moncton, NB. A known DNA sample was collected and compared to several persons who believed they could be family relatives. Those comparisons were unsuccessful. To date, all attempts to identify the deceased person have failed.

Case reference: 2013000130.CaseDesc: Norman Rivet was last seen on May 24, 1983 at home in Ville-Émard, a neighbourhood of Montreal.  He left a suicide note to his family.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: On February 5, 1991, Brian Adrain was seen for the last time. Brian’s abandoned vehicle was found west of Millarville, also known as McLean Creek, in the Kananaskis area in Alberta.

Case reference: 2005004299.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were recovered from the Niagara River bay area at the rear of the Sir Adam Beck Power Station, near the turbine intakes. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Mr. Baxter went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Mr. Baxter was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Shirt: May have been wearing a white pullover type shirt
Pants: May have been wearing brown corduroy pants or blue jeans

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2014001528.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1983, Herbert Keam stayed over at a friends house in Poplar River. Herbert asked his friend to walk with him to Norway House. His friend said no, but they walked together to Herbert's sister's house where they parted ways. Mr. Keam's sister indicated she saw Herbert that morning. He changed his clothing and left the residence without indicating what his plans were. Mr.Keam was reported missing on June 20, by his sister. Police later determined that Herbert was attempting to walk (112km's) to Norway House through the bush, however he started out in the wrong direction. The ground search utilized a police dog and various articles of clothing belonging to Herbert were found. The weather at this time was hot and muggy. Mr. Keam has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006026899.CaseDesc: Dr. Kemp left his residence in Sturgeon Falls, on May 19, 1960, to go fishing. On May 20, 1960, he failed to return home and was reported missing. On May 21, 1960, his vehicle was found parked at Finlayson Lake, McLaren Township, District of Nipissing. His canoe and personal belongings were located on the lake.

Case reference: 2012020645.CaseDesc: Peter Mckay was playing on the ice along the South Saskatchewan River in the Riversdale area of Saskatoon, SK in the late afternoon hours of December 31, 1986. Peter subsequently fell into an open portion of the river and was never found.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Orange, with a yellow stripe on the cuff

Case reference: 2012020065.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1979, Shane Olecka was reported missing to the Beausejour RCMP. Shane was last seen leaving his home the previous day to go rabbit hunting. He was an experienced woodsman and there was no logical reason for him to be overdue. The weather conditions worsened to 'blizzard-like' on December 3rd and made the search efforts very difficult. The police conducted ground searches with the assistances of a police dog, members from the Canadian Forces base and local volunteers. The ground search was terminated on December 8th due to inclement weather.

Jacket: Blue, Rabbit-fur trim on hood, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2006002699.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1996, a male was found in a field 50m north of Lakeshore Boulevard and 200m west of Spadina Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be 5'8"-5'9" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Staining of his teeth suggests that he may have been a smoker. He is estimated to have died a few weeks to months prior to his discovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Ponytail, ponytail 12" long with receding hairline
Teeth: His teeth have both amalgam fillings and many untreated cavities

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm , Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2014004773.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2000, Bassel El Youssef was seen for the last time when he left his mother’s residence in the Saint-Léonard District of Montreal, Quebec. Bassel has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006006499.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1972, Clifford Boyle was aboard the S.S. Gleneagle on which he was employed. He was last seen on the deck of the left side of the ship near the back.  It is presumed that Mr. Boyle fell overboard and is presumed drowned in Georgian Bay, Ontario.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, End of finger missing

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2014005202.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2008, Ani Ashekian last contacted her family. During the time of her disappearance, Ani, a world traveller, was vacationing in Hong Kong, China, with two friends. At some point during her trip, Ani checked out of her hotel room, and made two cash withdrawals from a ATM.

Case reference: 2019038949.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2019, Calvin Brown was last seen at his home in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Calvin boarded a flight to Jamaica and was scheduled to return on May 20, but has not returned home.

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2014005520.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2010, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Dina Bat-Og was seen for the last time leaving her home to go to work in Toronto, Ontario. Dina had advised that she would be returning home at midnight, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 2014004699.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2005, Veeravi Jeya Eskimuttu "VJ", was last seen leaving his place of employment in Saint John, NB. He is known to be transient and has lived in Toronto, Cornwall, Montreal and Halifax.

Case reference: 2018070577.CaseDesc: On January 15, 2018, at approximately 6:00pm, Albert Ramponi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001151.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1977, the body of a young unidentified man was found in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had taken his own life with a new “Savage 240 Series P” rifle that had been purchased in Gatineau, Quebec five days earlier.

Jacket: Corduroy, Tan, Padded with leather pads on shoulder
Shirt: White, With blue dots, Made in France

Case reference: 2014004498.CaseDesc: Guillermina Coleman left her residence in the Cypress View Foundation between 8:00 p.m. on July 4, and 10:00 a.m. on July 5, 2004. Mrs. Coleman was despondent, and was released from the hospital only a few days before she was last seen. Mrs. Coleman was only able to walk for short distances.

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2014005439.CaseDesc: John Sparrow was last seen in April or May of 2001, getting into an early 1990s black Chevrolet pick-up truck while accompanied by an unknown male driver. Mr. Sparrow and the unknown man left the parking lot of the Denny's restaurant located at Benson Ave and Division St, in the city of Kingston, Ontario and headed north past highway #401.

Case reference: 2014001237.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of a well nourished man were found floating in Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had his natural teeth and had taken his own life.

Case reference: 2006029199.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2006, a female was found in a field near the South Service Road and Holt Road near the Darlington Nuclear Plant in Bowmanville, Ontario. She may have been anemic, but a doctor may or may not have diagnosed this condition. Near the body there was a ring, size 9.5, that has a red garnet in the middle with a diamond on either side. The ring is stamped "Burns" on the inside and is believed to have been sold through Burns Jeweler in Oshawa, Ontario. A heart, a ribbon and a multi coloured "Blue Rodeo" brand t-shirt with a hood were also found in the vicinity of the remains and may or may not belong to her.

Teeth: Prominent upper teeth with visible white fillings on her front teeth; and small silver fillings in some back teeth.
Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Blue Rodeo with thick vertical stripes in red, green and blue.
Ring: Metal, Size 9.5, Burns logo, with a red garnet and two diamonds

Case reference: 2014004727.CaseDesc: Roger Belanger was last seen in May of 1984, in the Peace River, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014004526.CaseDesc: In 1999, Jesse Jurak was seen for the last time as he attended a family funeral in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1969,  three commercial fishermen sold their catch, purchased groceries and departed Jackpine Island for Brochet via Reindeer Lake. Mr. Bighetty left in his own canoe and was ahead of two other men who were also travelling by canoe. The second canoe later had mechanical problems and had to stop on an island. The two men indicated that they had heard the other canoe and figured it was Mr. Bighetty coming back to look for them. However, they never saw him again. Mr. Bighetty's canoe was located in the lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometers south of Brochet. It is presumed he drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014003512.CaseDesc: In early October 1992, Darlene Shallow was seen for the last time between Danforth Street and Midland Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004485.CaseDesc: Pablo Guerra was reported missing by his family on May 10, 2004. He had no health issues. Pablo's jacket was located in a body of water under the Second Narrows Bridge by Vancouver City Police Marine Section the day Pablo was last seen.

Jacket: Black, North Face embroidered on left breast

Case reference: 2020010931.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1987, at approximately 10:20am, Farad Khan was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Farad had left his home following an argument with his wife.

Case reference: 2014001666.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1995, Shawn McEleney was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. Shawn was known to attend the racing tracks in Edmonton and Calgary.

Case reference: 2018070168.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1986, the remains of a man were found near Floating Stone Lake in Alberta. This individual was deaf in their right ear. He had no upper teeth and likely wore an upper denture.

Case reference: 2014001140.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1973, the skeletal remains of a male were discovered 30 miles south of Kashechewan and 60 miles west of Moosonee - 30 feet from a small creek that flows into James Bay. He is estimated to have been dead for 9-12 months.

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2016070902.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2016, Campbell Hunter was last seen in Thompson, Manitoba. Mr. Hunter is known to lead an outdoor lifestyle and it is unusual for him not to contact his family.

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2021007962.CaseDesc: Robert Hutchison was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. On January 30, 2021, Robert contacted his family for the last time. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Left Wrist, Birthmark red dots under wrist
Scar: Shoulders, Several scars on right shoulder (clavicle)

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred
Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp

Case reference: 2012020074.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1988 Cathy Williams left her residence in St. Andrews, Manitoba to go to Winnipeg to fill out a job application.  She had made arrangements to meet a male acquaintance who was going to help her complete the application.  During the late afternoon and early evening, Cathy and her friend attended two bars and eventually ended up at a restaurant.  Cathy left her friend at the restaurant.  From the restaurant, Cathy attended the residence of another male acquaintance who invited her in for a visit.  She indicated she had to get her purse from her friends car and she was going to be back in half an hour.  This was the last time Cathy Williams was seen.  Cathy was reported missing by her mother on the morning of August 23, 1988.  Cathy has not been heard from again and her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Luggage: Blue, Metal box and a tent

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2014004947.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2007, Ralph Hopper was seen for the last time as he was leaving the l'Aboiteau residence, a special care home where he lived in Dieppe, New Brunswick. Ralph is mentally challenged, diabetic and requires prescription medication.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carlton Place, Ontario. Ms. Roy has lived in Carlton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Quebec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2020018331.CaseDesc: Riley Berland went missing from Frog Lake, Alberta, on May 31, 2020. Riley's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2000000830.CaseDesc: Charlene was last seen hitch-hiking at the intersection of Hwy 3 and the Rae Access Road.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2014001137.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1974, the body of a middle aged man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. His appendix had been removed and he had lost all of his teeth during his life. He is believed to have died about three weeks earlier from an overdose of barbiturates.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Jeans, With wooden buttons
Jacket: Nylon, Navy blue with red lining
